[TITLE]
<line: 4> UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
<line: 5> DISTRICT OF ARIZONA

[TEXT]
<line: 7> JUDGMENT IN A CRIMINAL CASE
<line: 8> (For Offenses Committed on or After November 1, 1987)

[TITLE]
<line: 10> United States of America

[TEXT]
<line: 12>       v.

[TEXT]
<line: 14> No.  CR 16-00385-001-TUC-CKJ(JR)

[TITLE]
<line: 16> Ana Erika Christian

[TEXT]
<line: 18> Myrna Beards, CJA Appointed
<line: 19> Attorney for Defendant

[TEXT]
<line: 21> USM#: 55173-408       ICE#: A208 201 288       

[TEXT]
<line: 23> THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF guilty on 7/8/2016 to Count 4 of the Indictment.

[TEXT]
<line: 25> ACCORDINGLY, THE COURT HAS ADJUDICATED THAT THE DEFENDANT IS GUILTY OF
<line: 26> THE FOLLOWING OFFENSE(S): violating Title 21 U.S.C. § 952(a) and § 960(a)(1) & (b)(3),
<line: 27> Importation of Marijuana, a Class C Felony offense, as charged in Count 4 of the Indictment. 

[TEXT]
<line: 29> IT IS THE JUDGMENT OF THIS COURT THAT the defendant is hereby committed to the
<line: 30> custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of TWELVE (12) MONTHS AND ONE (1) DAY with
<line: 31> credit for time served.  Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be placed on
<line: 32> supervised release for a term of THIRTY SIX (36) MONTHS.

[TEXT]
<line: 34> IT IS ORDERED that all remaining counts are dismissed on motion of the United States.

[TITLE]
<line: 36> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 38> The defendant shall pay to the Clerk the following total criminal monetary penalties:

[TEXT]
<line: 40> SPECIAL ASSESSMENT:   REMITTED
<line: 41> FINE:   Waived
<line: 42> RESTITUTION:   N/A

[TEXT]
<line: 44> On motion of the Government, the special assessment is REMITTED.

[TEXT]
<line: 46> The Court finds the defendant does not have the ability to pay a fine and orders the fine waived.

[TITLE]
<line: 48> SUPERVISED RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 50> Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant is placed on supervised release for a term of
<line: 51> THIRTY SIX (36) MONTHS.

[TEXT]
<line: 53> The defendant shall report to the probation office in the district to which the defendant is released
<line: 54> within 72 hours of release from the custody of the Bureau of Prisons.

[TEXT]
<line: 56> It is the order of the Court that, pursuant to General Order 12-13, which incorporates the
<line: 57> requirements of USSG §§5B1.3 and 5D1.2, you shall comply with the following conditions, of
<line: 58> particular importance, you shall not commit another federal, state or local crime during the term
<line: 59> of supervision and the defendant shall abstain from the use of illicit substances:1231231

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 4:16-cr-00385-CKJ-JR   Document 36   Filed 09/13/16   Page 2 of 3

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 1)
<line: 5> You shall not commit another federal, state, or local crime during the term of supervision.
<line: 6> 2)
<line: 7> You shall not leave the judicial district or other specified geographic area without the
<line: 8> permission of the Court or probation officer.
<line: 9> 3)
<line: 10> The defendant shall report to the probation officer in a manner and frequency directed by
<line: 11> the court or probation officer.
<line: 12> 4)
<line: 13> You shall answer truthfully all inquiries by the probation officer and follow the instructions
<line: 14> of the probation officer.
<line: 15> 5)
<line: 16> You shall support your dependents and meet other family responsibilities.
<line: 17> 6)
<line: 18> You shall work regularly at a lawful occupation unless excused by the probation officer for
<line: 19> schooling, training, or other acceptable reasons.
<line: 20> 7)
<line: 21> You shall notify the probation officer at least ten days prior to any change of residence or
<line: 22> employment.
<line: 23> 8)
<line: 24> You shall refrain from excessive use of alcohol and are subject to being prohibited from the
<line: 25> use of alcohol if ordered by the Court in a special condition of supervision.
<line: 26> 9)
<line: 27> You shall not purchase, possess, use, distribute or administer any narcotic or other
<line: 28> controlled substance as defined in section 102 of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C.
<line: 29> § 801) or any paraphernalia related to such substances, without a prescription by a licensed
<line: 30> medical practitioner.  The use or possession of medicinal marijuana, even with a physician’s
<line: 31> written certification, is not permitted.  Possession of controlled substances will result in
<line: 32> mandatory revocation of your term of supervision.
<line: 33> 10)
<line: 34> You shall not frequent places where controlled substances are illegally sold, used,
<line: 35> distributed or administered, or other places specified by the Court.
<line: 36> 11)
<line: 37> You shall not associate with any persons engaged in criminal activity, and shall not
<line: 38> associate with any person convicted of a felony unless granted permission to do so by the
<line: 39> probation officer.
<line: 40> 12)
<line: 41> You shall permit a probation officer to visit at any time at home or elsewhere and shall
<line: 42> permit confiscation of any contraband observed in plain view by the probation officer.
<line: 43> 13)
<line: 44> You shall immediately notify the probation officer (within forty-eight (48) hours if during a
<line: 45> weekend or on a holiday) of being arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer.
<line: 46> 14)
<line: 47> You shall not enter into any agreement to act as an informer or a special agent of a law
<line: 48> enforcement agency without the permission of the Court.
<line: 49> 15)
<line: 50> As directed by the probation officer, you shall notify third parties of risks that may be
<line: 51> occasioned by your criminal record or personal history or characteristics, and shall permit
<line: 52> the probation officer to make such notification and to confirm your compliance with such
<line: 53> notification requirement.
<line: 54> 16)
<line: 55> If you have ever been convicted of a felony, you shall refrain from possessing a firearm,
<line: 56> ammunition, destructive device, or other dangerous weapon.  If you have ever been
<line: 57> convicted of a misdemeanor involving domestic violence, you shall refrain from possession
<line: 58> of any firearm or ammunition.  Possession of a firearm will result in mandatory revocation
<line: 59> of your term of supervision.  This prohibition does not apply to misdemeanor cases that did
<line: 60> not entail domestic violence, unless a special condition is imposed by the Court.
<line: 61> 17)
<line: 62> Unless suspended by the Court, you shall submit to one substance abuse test within the first
<line: 63> 15 days of supervision and thereafter at least two, but no more than two periodic substance
<line: 64> abuse tests per year of supervision, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. §§ 3563(a)(5) and 3583(d);
<line: 65> 18)
<line: 66> If supervision follows a term of imprisonment, you shall report in person to the Probation
<line: 67> Office in the district to which you are released within seventy-two (72) hours of release.
<line: 68> 19)
<line: 69> You shall pay any monetary penalties as ordered by the Court.  You will notify the probation
<line: 70> officer of any material change in your economic circumstances that might affect your ability
<line: 71> to pay restitution, fines, or special assessments.
<line: 72> 20)
<line: 73> If you have ever been convicted of any qualifying federal or military offense (including any
<line: 74> federal felony) listed under 42 U.S.C. § 14135a(d)(1) or 10 U.S.C. § 1565(d), you shall
<line: 75> cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer pursuant to 42 U.S.C.
<line: 76> § 14135a(a)(2).
<line: 77> The following special conditions are in addition to the conditions of supervised release or
<line: 78> supersede any related standard condition:

[TEXT]
<line: 80> 1.
<line: 81> If deported, you shall not re-enter the United States without legal authorization.1231231

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 4:16-cr-00385-CKJ-JR  Document 36  Filed 09/13/16 Page 3 of 3

[TEXT]
<line: 4> THE COURT FINDS that you have been sentenced in accordance with the terms of the ORALLY
<line: 5> AMENDED plea agreement and that you have waived your right to appeal and to collaterally
<line: 6> attack this matter. The waiver has been knowingly and voluntarily made with a factual basis and
<line: 7> with an understanding of the consequences of the waiver.

[TEXT]
<line: 9> The Court may change the conditions of probation or supervised release or extend the term of
<line: 10> supervision, if less than the authorized maximum, at any time during the period of probation or
<line: 11> supervised release. The Court may issue a warrant and revoke the original or any subsequent
<line: 12> sentence for a violation occurring during the period of probation or supervised release.

[TEXT]
<line: 14> The Court orders commitment to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons

[TEXT]
<line: 16> Date of Imposition of Sentence: Tuesday, September 13, 2016

[FIGURE]

[TEXT]
<line: 19> DATED this 13th day of September, 2016

[TEXT]
<line: 21> Cindy K. Jorgenson.
<line: 22> United States District Judge.

[TITLE]
<line: 24> RETURN

[TEXT]
<line: 26> I have executed this Judgment as follows:
<line: 27> Defendant delivered on.
<line: 28> to
<line: 29> at
<line: 30> , the
<line: 31> institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons, with a certified copy of this judgment in a Criminal case.
<line: 32> By:
<line: 33> United States Marshal.
<line: 34> Deputy Marshal
